snippet: A recent study illustrates a drawback of GPS technology: that it could be causing drivers to become too docile as their navigational skills atrophy.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column highlights study illustrating that a drawback of GPS technology is that it could be causing drivers to become too docile as their navigational skills atrophy; points out that researchers videotaped drivers using GPS technology, and human error was responsible for many of the problems that occurred.
lead_paragraph: A recent study illustrates a drawback of GPS technology: that it could be causing drivers to become too docile as their navigational skills atrophy.

headline.seo: GPS and Human Error Can Lead Drivers Astray - Digital Domain
headline.main: When GPS Confuses, You May Be to Blame
headline.print_headline: When GPS Confuses, You May Be to Blame
